final_answer:
The humor or satire in this image comes from the contrast between the advertised storage capacity and the actual available storage on the phone. The box claims the phone has "256GB," but the phone itself shows only "235.35 GB of available space." 

The text "YES, BUT" humorously highlights this discrepancy, pointing out a common issue where advertised storage doesn't match what is available due to pre-installed software and system files. This exaggerates the expectation versus reality trope in consumer electronics.
ground_truth: The images are funny since they show how smartphone manufacturers advertise their smartphones to have a high internal storage space but in reality, the amount of space available to an user is considerably less due to pre-installed software
